text:
together today means something very 
different than a year ago and i feel

that everyone feels the same everyone 
no matter where no matter how they live

no matter where they live no matter what 
age like it just means something different

when we went into lockdown me and my family 
and all the team that i worked with we were

just as scared as anyone else we didn't have even 
half the answers so the government is advising

that we try and stay at home and i'm definitely 
doing that with my family hunkering down already

the supermarkets were selling out of stuff and 
they didn't have eggs they didn't have this that

and the other so i had to adjust to that now you 
would normally sweeten this with sugar we actually

haven't got any sugar left in the house so we're 
gonna use apricot jam and then immediately me and

joe started filming on our phones and i had to 
go from teaching recipes to teaching principals

and of course it was full of more optimism but 
still you weren't allowed to have your family

in your home now the vaccination program's 
kind of doing its thing together the show

together the book is about maybe just maybe 
the idea of having people around your house

and maybe that's worth a little bit more this 
year than last year so this is actually my home

and it looked really nice last week now 
look at it look at my colorful girls

you know it is about not just the food but you 
know how you serve the food is it family service

is it plated up and at the same time for the 
first time ever i've invited complete strangers

into my home and we've got teachers we've got 
doctors nursery teachers midwives volunteers

so my name's sheena my name's lisa 
i'm part of the bounds green food bank

i've been volunteering at several vaccination 
centers very exciting to meet jamie oliver

i might have to poke him to see if he's real 
i've been so excited it's just the fact of just

enjoying really nice food round the table when was 
the last time you really could do that i know it's

only a small handful of people that represent 
millions but it feels right it feels a pleasure

and i'm certainly grateful for all of them 
for what they've done for us it's all quite

emotional really it's all quite emotional but 
i think um but i think like the emotional bit

it's not just because i'm like in the midlife 
crisis and sort of like 46 years old um it's

not just that it it's just that i'm i don't care 
like i think a lot of people have like had enough

and actually the simple things 
in life cup of tea bit of cake

so for me like i mean i can only really 
talk about this in the way that i'm

you know allowed to really which is 
through food and i think food is just

the most incredible excuse 
to get people together you
